buildup.text: Kublai Khan established the Yuan dynasty in 1271, uniting China under foreign rule for the first time.

discovery.text: He built a new capital at Khanbaliq (modern Beijing) and welcomed scholars, merchants, and diplomats.

twist.text: He tried twice to invade Japan. Both fleets were destroyed by typhoonsâ€”the 'kamikaze' divine winds.

climax.text: The Yuan dynasty lasted less than a century. Mongols could conquer China but couldn't hold it.

punchline.text: Even conquerors couldn't tame China forever.
